definition: mountain pass/to close/to shut/to turn off/to concern/to involve

to fall/to drop/to lag behind/to lose/to go missing/to reduce/fall (in prices)/to lose (value, weight etc)/to wag/to swing/to turn/to change/to exchange/to swap/to show off/to shed (hair)/(used after certain verbs to express completion, fulfillment, removal etc)

sentences.english: Have you turned off the water valve?
The breeze fanned our faces, please turn the fan off.
sentences.chinese: 微风轻轻吹在我们的脸上，请把电扇关掉。

sentences.english: Boon walked in and quieted the engine.
sentences.chinese: 布恩走进来，关掉发动机。

sentences.english: Turn off the notification function on your email program.
sentences.chinese: 关掉电子邮件程序的自动通知功能。

sentences.english: Make a commitment to turning off the TV and spending some quality time with your loved ones.
sentences.chinese: 约定好关掉电视机，与家人共渡一段高质量的时光。

sentences.english: It dawned on me that I'd left the oven on.
sentences.chinese: 我突然想起烘箱未曾关掉。

sentences.english: Turn off the phone and ignore incoming texts.
Cy jordan silenced the warning horn .
sentences.chinese: 赛伊乔丹关掉了报警喇叭。

sentences.english: Thus, before the property management of residence turned off the valve, my grandmother's house was flooded.
sentences.chinese: 于是乎，在物业把总阀门关掉之前，姥姥家发大水了。

sentences.english: A really nice trick is to switch off your monitor when you’re typing.
sentences.chinese: 一个非常好的技巧是在打字的时候关掉显示器。

sentences.english: Try disabling the audio in CCE.
Turn off the TV and read great books. They open doors in your brain.
sentences.chinese: 关掉电视，阅读伟大的著作，它会开启你的智慧之门。

sentences.english: I turned off the basketball game and started to write.
sentences.chinese: 我关掉了电视上的篮球比赛，开始书写。

sentences.english: Try closing down volume controls and retrying.
sentences.chinese: 请关掉音量控制后重试。

sentences.english: If cabling is correct, power off the device and reseat the interface card.
sentences.chinese: 假如缆线连接是正确的，关掉设备且重新插入介面卡。

sentences.english: Remember to turn off the television whenever reading.
sentences.chinese: 阅读时也要先关掉电视。

definition: to close (a door)/to turn off (light, electrical equipment etc)
power switch/gas valve/to open the city (or frontier) gate/to open and close/to switch on and off
to turn off (a machine or device)/to finish shooting a film
to press down/to press a button
to open/to show (a ticket)/to turn on/to switch on
to stop burning/to go out (of fire)/to die out/extinguished
